p: The viral particles are then excreted at high dose in the stool (107 infectious particles per gram of stool) [ FAO/WHO (Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations/World Health Organization), 2008]. Enteric viruses are characterized by their stability outside of their host, which can generally withstand environmental stresses (with variations according to the virus) such as acid, heat, drought, pressure, disinfectants, and ultraviolet radiation [ FAO/WHO (Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations/World Health Organization), 2008].
